2.t: This Book is a revelation from God, the Majestic and All-knowing

3.t: who forgives sins, who accepts repentance, whose punishment is severe, and whose bounty is universal. He is the only Lord and to Him all things proceed.
3.tr: Ghaafiriz zambi Wa-qaabilit tawbi shadeedil 'iqaabi zit tawli laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa ilaihil maseer

4.t: No one disputes the revelations of the Lord except the disbelievers. Let not their activities in the land deceive you.
4.tr: Maa yujaadilu feee Aayaatil laahi illal lazeena kafaroo falaa yaghrurka taqallubuhum fil bilaad

5.t: The people of Noah who lived before and the Confederate tribes who lived after them rejected Our revelations. Every nation schemed against its Messengers to seize them and disputed against them to defeat the truth. But torment struck them and how terrible was their retribution!
5.tr: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohinw wal-Ahzaabu min ba'dihim Wa-hammat kullu ummatin bi-Rasoolihim li-ya'khuzoohu Wa-jaadaloo bilbaatili li-yud-hidoo bihil haqqa fa-akhaztuhum fa-kaifa kaana 'iqaab

6.t: The word of your Lord that the disbelievers will be the dwellers of hell fire has already been decreed.
6.tr: Wa-kazaalika haqqat Kalimatu Rabbika 'alal lazeena kafarooo annahum Ashaabun Naar

7.t: The bearers of the Throne glorify their Lord with His praise. They believe in Him and ask Him to forgive the believers. They say, "Our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge encompass all things. Forgive those who turn to You in repentance and follow Your path. Lord, save them from the torment of hell.
7.tr: Allazeena yahmiloonal 'Arsha Wa-man hawlahoo yusabbihoona bihamdi Rabbihim Wa-yu'minoona bihee Wa-yastaghfiroona lillazeena aamanoo Rabbanaa wasi'ta kulla shai'ir rahmatanw Wa-'ilman faghfir lillazeena taaboo wattaba'oo sabeelaka Wa-qihim 'azaabal Jaheem

8.t: Lord, admit them and their fathers, spouses, and offspring who have reformed themselves to the gardens of Eden which You have promised them. You are Majestic and All-wise.
8.tr: Rabbannaa Wa-adkhilhum Jannaati 'adninil latee wa'attahum Wa-man salaha min aabaaa'ihim Wa-azwaajihim Wa-zurriyyaatihim; innaka Antal 'Azeezul Hakeem

9.t: Lord, keep them away from evil deeds. Whomever You have saved from evil on the Day of Judgment has certainly been granted Your mercy and this is the greatest triumph.
9.tr: Wa-qihimus saiyi-aat; Wa-man taqis saiyi-aati Yawma'izin faqad rahimtah; Wa-zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem

10.t: The disbelievers will be told, "God's hatred towards you is much greater than your hatred of your own selves. You were called to the faith but you disbelieved".
10.tr: Innal lazeena kafaroo yunaadawna lamaqtul laahi akbaru mim maqtikum anfusakum iz tud'awna ilal eemaani fatakfuroon

11.t: They say, "Lord, You have caused us to die twice and You have brought us back to life twice. We have confessed our sins, so is there any way out of this (hell)?"
11.tr: Qaaloo Rabbanaaa amat tanasnataini Wa-ahyaitanas nataini fa'tarafnaa bizunoo-binaa fahal ilaa khuroojim min sabeel

12.t: They will be answered, "Your suffering is only because you disbelieved when One God was mentioned. When other things were considered equal to Him, you believed in them. Judgment belongs to God, the Most High, the Most Great.
12.tr: Zaalikum bi-annahooo izaa du'iyal laahu wahdahoo kafartum Wa-ien yushrak bihee tu'minoo; falhukmu lillaahil 'Aliyyil Kabeer

13.t: It is He who has shown you the evidence of His existence and has sent you sustenance from the sky, yet only those who turn to God in repentance take heed.
13.tr: Huwal lazee yureekum Aayaatihee Wa-yunazzilu lakum minas samaaa'i rizqaa; Wa-maa tatazakkaru illaa maien yuneeb

14.t: Worship God and be devoted to His religion even though the disbelievers dislike this.
14.tr: Fad'ul laaha mukhliseena lahud deena Wa-law karihal kaafiroon

15.t: God is the promoter of His servants and the owner of the Throne. He sends His spirit by His command to whichever of His servants He wants to warn them of the Day of Judgment.
15.tr: Rafee'ud darajaati zul 'Arshi yulqir rooha min amrihee 'alaa mai yashaaa'u min 'ibaadihee liyunzira yawmat talaaq

16.t: Nothing will remain hidden from God concerning them on the day when they appear before God (from their graves) (It will be asked), "To whom does the kingdom belong on this Day?" (It will be answered), "The kingdom belongs to the Almighty One God".
16.tr: Yawma hum baarizoona laa yakhfaa 'alal laahi minhum shai; limanil mulkul Yawma lillaahil Waahidil Qahaar

17.t: Every soul will be recompensed for its deeds on this Day. There will be no injustice. Certainly God's reckoning is swift.
17.tr: Al-Yawma tujzaa kullu nafsim bimaa kasabat; laa zulmal Yawm; innal laaha saree'ul hisaab

18.t: (Muhammad), warn them of the approaching day when because of hardship and frustration their hearts will almost reach up to their throats. The unjust will have no friends nor any intercessor who will be heard.
18.tr: Wa-anzirhum yawmal aazifati izil quloobu ladal hanaajiri kaazimeen; maa lizzaalimeena min hameeminw Wa-laa shafee'ien yutaa'

19.t: God knows the disloyalty of the eyes and what the hearts conceal.
19.tr: Ya'lamu khaaa'inatal a'yuni Wa-maa tukhfis sudoor

20.t: God judges with Truth but those whom they worship besides God can have no Judgment. God is certainly All-hearing and All-aware.
20.tr: Wallaahu yaqdee bilhaqq, wallazeena yad'oona min doonihee laa yaqdoona bishai'; innal laaha Huwas Samee'ul Baseer

21.t: Have they not travelled through the land to see the terrible end of those who lived before them. They had been mightier than them in power and in leaving their traces on earth. God punished them for their sins. They had no one to save them from God's torment.
21.tr: Awalam yaseeroo fil ardi fa-yanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena kaanoo min qablihim; kaanoo hum ashadda minhum quwwatanw Wa-aasaaran fil ardi fa-akhazahumul laahu bizunoobihim Wa-maa kaana lahum minal laahi minw waaq

22.t: Messengers had come to them with illustrious miracles but they disbelieved and thus God struck them with His torment. He is Mighty and Severe in His retribution.
22.tr: Zaalika bi-annahum kaanat taateehim Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati fakafaroo fa-akhazahumul laah; innahoo qawiyyun shadeedul 'iqaab

23.t: We sent Moses with Our miracles and clear authority.
23.tr: Wa-laqad arsalnaa Moosaa bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-sultaanim mubeen

24.t: to the Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah, who said, "He is only a lying magician.".
24.tr: Ilaa Fir'awna Wa-Haamaana Wa-Qaaroona faqaaloo saahirun kazzaab

25.t: When We sent him to them for a genuine purpose, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed in him but keep their women alive." The plots of the unbelievers can only result in failure.
25.tr: Falama jaaa'ahum bil-haqqi min 'indinaa qaaluq tulooo abnaaa'al lazeena aamanoo ma'ahoo wastahyoo nisaaa'ahum; Wa-maa kaidul kaafireena illaa fee dalaal

26.t: The Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call for help from his Lord. I am afraid that he will change your religion or spread evil through the land.".
26.tr: Wa-qaala Fir'awnu zarooneee aqtul Moosaa walyad'u Rabbahoo inneee akhaafu ai yubaddila deenakum aw aien yuzhira fil ardil fasaad

27.t: Moses said, "I seek protection from your and my Lord against every arrogant person who has no faith in the Day of Judgment."
27.tr: Wa-qaala Moosaaaa innee 'uztu bi-Rabbee Wa-Rabbikum min kulli mutakabbiril laayu'minu bi Yawmil Hisaab

28.t: A believing person from the people of the Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Would you kill a man just because he says God is my Lord? He has brought you illustrious miracles from your Lord. If he speaks lies, it will only harm him, but if he speaks the Truth, some of his warnings may affect you. God does not guide a transgressing liar.
28.tr: Wa-qaala rajulum mu'minummin Aali Fir'awna yaktumu eemaanahooo ataqtuloona rajulan aien yaqoola Rabbi-yal laahu Wa-qad jaaa'akum bil baiyinaati mir Rabbikum Wa-iny yaku kaaziban fa'alaihi kazibuh Wa-ien yaku saadiqaien yasibkum ba'dul lazee ya'idukum innal laaha laa yahdee man huwa musrifun kazzaab

29.t: My people, today you have the kingdom and the power on earth but who will help us against the wrath of God if it will befall us?" The Pharaoh said, "I show you only what I think is proper and guide you only to the right direction".
29.tr: Yaa-qawmi lakumul mulkul yawma zaahireena fil ardi famaien yansurunaa mim baasil laahi in jaaa'anaa; qaala Fir'awnu maaa ureekum illaa maaa araa Wa-maaa ahdeekum illaa sabeelar Rashaad

30.t: The believing man said, "I am afraid that you will face a (terrible) day like that of the groups:
30.tr: Wa-qaalal lazee aamana yaa-qawmi inneee akhaafu 'alaikum misla yawmil Ahzaab

31.t: people of Noah, Ad, Thamud, and those after them. God did not want injustice for His servants.
31.tr: Misla daabi qawmi Noohinw Wa-'aadinw Wa-Samooda wallazeena mim ba'dihim; Wa-mal laahu yureedu zulmal lil'ibaad

32.t: My people, I am afraid for you on (the Day of Judgment), when people will cry for help.

33.t: On that day you will run away, but no one will be able to protect you from (God's Judgment). No one can guide one whom God has caused to go astray.
33.tr: Yawma tuwalloona mud-bireena maa lakum minal laahi min 'aasim; Wa-maien yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo min haad

34.t: Joseph came to you before with illustrious evidence but you still have doubts about what he brought. When he passed away, you said, "God will never send any Messenger after him." Thus does God causes to go astray the skeptical transgressing people,
34.tr: Wa-laqad jaaa'akum Yoosufu min qablu bil-baiyyinaati famaa ziltum fee shakkim mimaa jaaa'akum bihee hattaaa izaa halaka qultum laien yab-asal laahu mim ba'dihee Rasoolaa; kazaalika yudillul laahu man huwa Musrifum murtaab

35.t: those who dispute the revelations of God without having received clear authority. This act greatly angers God and the believers. Thus does God seal the hearts of every arrogant oppressor."
35.tr: Allazeena yujaadiloona feee Aaayaatil laahi bighairi sultaanin ataahum kabura maqtan 'indal laahi Wa-'indal lazeena aamanoo; kazaalika yatbahul laahu 'alaa kulli qalbi mutakabbirin jabbaar

36.t: Pharaoh said, "Haman, build a tower of baked bricks for me so that I shall have access.
36.tr: Wa-qaala Fir'awnu yaa Haamaanub-ni lee sarhal la'alleee ablughul asbaab

37.t: to the heavens and be able to climb up to the Lord of Moses. I think that Moses is lying." Thus, Pharaoh's evil deeds seemed attractive to him and prevented him from the right path. The Pharaoh's plots only led him to his own destructor.
37.tr: Asbaabas samaawaati faattali'a ilaaa ilaahi Moosaa Wa-innee la-azunnuhoo kaazibaa; Wa-kazaalika zuyyina li-Fir'awna sooo'u 'amalihee Wa-sudda 'anis sabeel; Wa-maa kaidu Fir'awna illaa fee tabaab

38.t: The believing man said, "My people, follow me and I shall show you the right guidance.
38.tr: Wa-qaalal lazeee aamana yaa-qawmit tabi'ooni ahdikum sabeelar rashaad

39.t: My people, this worldly life is only the means (to an end), but the life hereafter will be the everlasting abode.
39.tr: Yaa-qawmi innamaa haazihil hayaatud dunyaa mataa'unw Wa-innal Aakhirata hiya daarul qaraar

40.t: Whoever commits evil deeds will be recompensed to the same degree. The righteously striving believer, male or female, will enter Paradise wherein they will receive their sustenance without any account being kept.
40.tr: Man 'amila saiyi'atan falaa yujzaaa illaa mislahaa Wa-man 'amila saaliham min zakarin aw unsaa Wa-huwa mu'minun fa-ulaaa'ika yadkhuloonal Jannata yurzaqoona feehaa bighairi hisaab

41.t: My people, "How strange is it that I invite you to salvation when you invite me to the fire.
41.tr: Wa-yaa-qawmi maa leee ad'ookum ilan najaati Wa-tad'oonaneee ilan Naar

42.t: You call me to disbelieve in God and to believe other things equal to Him about which I have no knowledge. I call you to the Majestic and All-forgiving One.
42.tr: Tad'oonanee li-akfura billaahi Wa-ushrika bihee maa laisa lee bihee 'ilmunw Wa-ana ad'ookum ilal 'Azeezil Ghaffaar

43.t: The idols to which you invite me certainly have no claim to be deities in this world or in the life to come. Our return is to God and the transgressors will be the dwellers of hell fire.
43.tr: Laa jarama annamaa tad'oonanee ilaihi laisa lahoo da'watun fid dunyaa Wa-laa fil Aakhirati Wa-anna maraddanaaa ilal laahi Wa-annal musrifeena hum Ashaabun Naar

44.t: You will soon recall what I have told you. I entrust God with my affairs. God is Well Aware of His servants."
44.tr: Fasatazkuroona maaa aqoolu lakum; Wa-ufawwidu amreee ilal laah; innal laaha baseerum bil'ibaad

45.t: God protected him against their evil plans and the people of the Pharaoh were struck by the most horrible torment.
45.tr: Fa-waqaahul laahu saiyyiaati maa makaroo Wa-haaqa bi Aali-Fir'awna sooo'ul 'azaab

46.t: They will be exposed to the fire in the mornings and the evenings and on the Day of Judgment, they will be told, "People of the Pharaoh, suffer the most severe torment."
46.tr: An-Naaru yu'radoona 'alaihaa ghuduwwanw Wa-'ashiyyanw Wa-Yawma taqoomus Saa'aatu adkhilooo Aala Fir'awna ashaddal 'azaab

47.t: During a dispute in the fire, the suppressed ones will say to those who had dominated them, "We were your followers. Can you now relieve us of our suffering in the fire?"
47.tr: Wa-iz yatahaaajjoona fin Naari fa-yaqoolud du'afaaa'u lillazeenas takbarooo innaa kunnaa lakum taba'an fahal antum mughnoona annaa naseebam minan Naar

48.t: The ones who had dominated them will say, "All of us are now in hell. God has already issued His Judgment of His servants (and no one can change this)."
48.tr: Qaalal lazeenas takbarooo innaa kullun feehaaa innal laaha qad hakama baynal 'ibaad

49.t: The dwellers of hell fire will ask its keepers, "Pray to your Lord to relieve us from the torment at least for one day".
49.tr: Wa-qaalal lazeena fin Naari likhazanati Jahannamad 'oo Rabbakum yukhaffif 'annaa yawmam minal 'azaab

50.t: The keepers will ask them, "Did your Messengers not come to you with illustrious evidence (of the Truth)? They will reply, "Yes, they did." The keepers will then say, "You may pray but the prayer of the disbelievers will not be answered".
50.tr: Qaalooo awalam taku taateekum Rusulukum bilbaiyinaati qaaloo balaa' qaaloo fad'oo; Wa-maa du'aaa'ul kaafireena illaa fee dalaal

51.t: We shall help Our Messengers and the believers, in this life and on the day when witness will come forward.
51.tr: Innaa lanansuru Rusulanaa wallazeena aamanoo fil hayaatid dunyaa Wa-Yawma yaqoomul ashhaad

52.t: The excuses of the unjust will be of no benefit to them on that day. They will be condemned to live in a most terrible abode.
52.tr: Yawma laa yanfa'uz zaalimeena ma'ziratuhum Wa-lahumul la'natu Wa-lahum soooud daar

53.t: To Moses We had given guidance and to the children of Israel We had given the Book
53.tr: Wa-laqad aatainaa Moosal hudaa Wa-awrasnaa Baneee Israaa-'eelal Kitaab

54.t: as their inheritance and as a guide and a reminder to the people of understanding.

55.t: (Muhammad), exercise patience. The promise of God is true. Seek forgiveness for your sins and glorify your Lord with His praise in the evenings and in the early mornings.
55.tr: Fasbir inna wa'dal laahi haqqunw wastaghfir lizambika Wa-sabbih bihamdi Rabbika bil'ashiyyi wal-ibkaar

56.t: Those who dispute the revelations of God without having received any authority do so because of their arrogance, but their arrogance cannot bring them any success. Seek protection from God for He is All-hearing and All-aware.
56.tr: Innal lazeena yujaadi-loona feee Aayaatil laahi bighairi sultaanin ataahum in fee sudoorihim illaa kibrum maa hum bibaaligheeh; fasta'iz billaahi innahoo Huwas Samee'ul Baseer

57.t: The creation of the heavens and the earth is certainly greater than the creation of mankind, but most people do not know.
57.tr: Lakhalqus samaawaati wal-ardi akbaru min khalqin naasi Wa-laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon

58.t: Just as the blind and the seeing are not equal, so are the righteously striving believers and the sinners are not equal. How little to this you pay attention.
58.tr: Wa-maa yastawil a'maa walbaseeru wallazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati Wa-lal museee'; qaleelam maa tatazakkaroon

59.t: The Hour of Doom will inevitably come, but most people do not have faith.
59.tr: Innas Saa'ata la-aatiyatul laa raiba feehaa Wa-laakinna aksaran naasi laa yu'minoon

60.t: Your Lord has said, "Pray to Me for I shall answer you prayers. Those who are too proud to worship Me will soon go to hell in disgrace".
60.tr: Wa-qaala Rabbukumud 'ooneee astajib lakum; innal lazeena yastakbiroona an 'ibaadatee sa-yadkhuloona jahannama daakhireen

61.t: It is God Who has made the night for you to rest and the day for you to see. God is Benevolent to the human being, but most people do not give Him due thanks.
61.tr: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul laila littaskunoo feehi wannahaara mubsiraa; innal laaha lazoo fadlin 'alan naasi Wa-laakinna aksaran naasi laa yashkuroon

62.t: It is God, your Lord, Who has created all things. He is the only Lord. Why then do you turn away from His worship to the worshipping of idols?
62.tr: Zaalikumul laahu Rabbukum khaaliqu kulli shai'in; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fa-annaa tu'fakoon

63.t: Thus are indeed those who have rejected the revelations of God.
63.tr: Kazaalika yu'fakul lazeena kaanoo bi-Aayaatil laahi yajhadoon

64.t: It is God who has created the earth as a place for you to live and the sky as a dome above you. He has shaped you in the best form and has provided you with pure sustenance. This is God, your Lord. Blessed is God, the Lord of the Universe.
64.tr: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul arda qaraaranw wassa-maaa'a binaaa'anw Wa-sawwarakum fa-ahsana suwarakum Wa-razaqakum minat taiyibaat; zaalikumul laahu Rabbukum fatabaarakal laahu Rabbul 'aalameen

65.t: He is the Everlasting and the only Lord. So worship Him and be devoted to His religion. It is only God, the Lord of the Universe who deserves all praise.
65.tr: Huwal Hayyu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fad'oohu mukh liseena lahudeen; alhamdu lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen

66.t: (Muhammad), say, "I have been forbidden to worship whatever you worship besides God after receiving clear evidence from my Lord. I have been commanded to submit myself to the will of the Lord of the Universe".
66.tr: Qul innee nuheetu an a'budal lazeena tad'oona min doonil laahi lammaa jaaa'a-niyal baiyinaatu mir Rabbee Wa-umirtu an uslima li-Rabbil 'aalameen

67.t: It is He Who created you from clay, turning it into a living germ, then into a clot of blood, and then brings you forth as a child. He then made you grow into manhood and become old. He causes some of you to live for the appointed time and some of you to die before so that perhaps you may have understanding.
67.tr: Huwal lazee khalaqakum min turaabin summa min nutfatin summa min 'alaqatin summa yukhrijukum tiflan summa litablughooo ashuddakum summa litakoonoo shuyookhaa; Wa-minkum maien yutawaffaa min qablu Wa-litablughooo ajalam musam-manw wa-la'allakum ta'qiloon

68.t: It is He Who gives life and causes things to die. When He decides to do something, He only says, "Exist," and it comes into existence.
68.tr: Huwal lazee yuhyee Wa-yumeetu fa-izaa qadaaa amran fa-innamaa yaqoolu lahoo kun fa-yakoon

69.t: Have you not seen how those who dispute the revelations of God, turn away from Truth to falsehood?
69.tr: Alam tara ilal lazeena yujaadiloona feee Aayaatil laahi annaa yusrafoon

70.t: Those who rejected the Book and the message which was given to Our Messenger will soon know (the consequences of their evil deeds).
70.tr: Allazeena kazzaboo bil-Kitaabi Wa-bimaa arsalnaa bihee Rusulanaa fasawfa ya'lamoon

71.t: when fetters will be placed around their necks and chains will drag them
71.tr: Izil aghlaalu feee a'naaqi-him wassalaasilu yushaboon

72.t: into boiling water and then they will be burned in the fire.
72.tr: Fil hameemi summa fin Naari Yasjaroon

73.t: Then they will be asked, "Where are the idols which you worshipped besides God?"
73.tr: Summaa qeela lahum ayna maa kuntum tushrikoon

74.t: They will reply, "They have abandoned us. In fact, we had worshipped nothing" Thus does God cause the disbelievers to go astray.
74.tr: Min doonil laahi qaaloo dalloo 'annaa bal lam nakun nad'oo min qablu shai'aa; kazaalika yudillul laahul kaafireen

75.t: They will be told, "This (torment) is the result of your unreasonable happiness on the earth and of your propagation of falsehood.
75.tr: Zaalikum bimaa kuntum tafrahoona fil ardi bighairil haqqi Wa-bimaa kuntum tamrahoon

76.t: Enter the gates of hell to live therein forever. How terrible is the dwelling of the arrogant ones.
76.tr: Udkhulooo abwaaba Jahannama khaalideena feehaa fabi'sa maswal mutakabbireen

77.t: (Muhammad), exercise patience. The promise of God is true. Whether We let you witness the suffering with which they were threatened or because of your death (you do not see them suffering,), We shall still punish them when they return to Us (on the Day of Judgment).
77.tr: Fasbir inna wa'dal laahi haqq; fa-immaa nuriyannak ba'dal lazee na'i-duhum aw natawaffayannaka fa-ilainaa yurja'oon

78.t: We have told you the stories of some of Our Messengers whom We had sent before you and We have not told you the stories of some others. A Messenger is not supposed to show a miracle without the permission of God. When God's decree of punishment comes to pass, He will judge truthfully and the supporters of the falsehood will perish when God's decree of punishemnt comes to pass.
78.tr: Wa-laqad arsalnaa Rusulam min qablika minhum man qasasnaa 'alaika Wa-minhum mal lam naqsus 'alaik; Wa-maa kaana li-Rasoolin any yaatiya bi-Aayatin illaa bi-iznil laah; fa-izaa jaaa'a amrul laahi qudiya bilhaqqi Wa-khasira hunaalikal mubtiloon

79.t: It is God Who has created cattle for you to ride and to consume as food.
79.tr: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul an'aama litarkaboo minhaa Wa-minhaa taakuloon

80.t: You may also obtain other benefits from them. You may ride them to seek whatever you need or be carried by them as ships carry you by sea.
80.tr: Wa-lakum feehaa manaafi'u Wa-litablughoo 'alaihaa haajatan fee sudoorikum Wa-'alaihaa Wa-'alal fulki tuhmaloon

81.t: God shows you the evidence (of His existence). How can you then deny such evidence?
81.tr: Wa-yureekum Aayaatihee fa-ayya Aayaatil laahi tunkiroon

82.t: Have they not travelled through the land to see the terrible end of those who lived before them? They were far mightier in both number and power and in what they had established. Their (worldly) gains were of no benefit to them.
82.tr: Afalam yaseeroo fil ardi fa-yanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena min qablihim; kaanoo aksara minhum Wa-ashadda quwwatanw Wa-aasaaran fil ardi famaaa aghnaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yaksiboon

83.t: They were far too content with their own knowledge (to pay attention to the Messengers) when Our Messengers came to them with illustrious evidence. They were encompassed by the torment for mocking Our guidance.
83.tr: Falammaa jaaa'at-hum Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati farihoo bimaa 'indahum minal 'ilmi Wa-haaqa bihim maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon

84.t: They said, "We believe in One God and disbelieve in whatever we had considered equal to Him," when they experienced Our wrath.
84.tr: Falammaa ra-aw baasanaa qaalooo aamannaa billaahi wahdahoo Wa-kafarnaa bimaa kunnaa bihee mushrikeen

85.t: Their faith proved to be of no benefit to them when they became subject to Our torment. Such was God's prevailing tradition among His servants in the past. Thus were the unbelievers destroyed.
85.tr: Falam yaku tanfa-'uhum eemaanuhum lammaa ra-aw ba'sana sunnatal laahil latee qad khalat fee 'ibaadihee Wa-khasira hunaalikal kaafiroon
